page.title: 09SCAWSBY HALL AND FARM 1
page.content: {Scawsby Hall}and Farm is rented by Mr and Mrs John Harrison. They only rent the bottom half of the stone hall most of which is Tudor,some far older. There's said to be a ghost, which the Harrisons call Charlie, who was one of the rebels camped on{Scawsby Lees}and slaughtered in the hall. Mr Harrison now farms 270 acres of land. The farm has grown smaller over the years to make way for two schools (one of which is ours), a college and a housing estate. This summer they are growing sugarbeet,wheat,barley,rape, and a few potatoes. The rest of the land is used for grazing calves,cows and bulls.They breed their own calves, fatten them for about two years then they are killed for meat. Combine harvesters,beet harvesters and tractors with lots of attachments are all used to work the land.
